comments.text: 10 mins to get to Plovdiv

Traffic is slowing down because of the "vignette" toll and enough place for card to trucks to stop for a good 500m.
Off season better to accept rides only to Plovdiv/turkish border.

5 minutes
Sign : Plovdiv
A man gave me a ride on a gaz station on the A1.
From there 5 others minutes to find a car to Plovdiv
Hittchiked here 5 times to Plovdiv, longest wait was 15 minutes. Even 2 groups (3 and 2 people) was very fast to get a car.

Easy place to get to Plovdiv, not so much to get to Burgas directly, so probably better to first get to a gas station on the road to Plovdiv (and on to Burgas) and from there talk to people to get further.
waited 1 minute ^) got a ride to the border
I'm not am expert but this place is really good. We jump of the bus 59 after 6-8 min and wait just 10 min. :-)
waited 45 mins then went by bus..there were other 5 people hitchhiking and that maybe confused drivers.
There are no cafes in that village. But you can find a nice little shop where Vojnishko Vastanije and Pernishko Shose crose. Very nice cafeowner :)
To this place you can go with bus 58 from Sofia. You must get down in first station in Vladaia and then you go to Pernisko shose street.
Pretty easy to reach by bus from Sofia Center
Super nice spot! There were two of us and we got a lift to the Plovdiv suburban almost immediately

5 minute with the sign, and a Turkish truckdriver stopped, and took us until Istanbul. he told that trucks often take hitchhiker on that route, but be aware that they can't pass the border just with only one extra person, so if you are two, one has to pass the passanger-gate. less confusion, if you leave the truck before the border, because after it's just all mess.
Just get out one car and sit to another one to plovdiv. 1 minute of waiting))
We waited 10 minutes for a ride to Rila
Amazing spot for HH towards Sofia, done it three times and people always stop.

Great place in Sofia direction.

3 times and no more than 15 minutes... one time seriously no more than 1 minute!
Straight ride to Sofia, despite it was late morning of Easter we got a ride with no time.
Despite it was late morning of Easter day we managed it in no time.

This is a spot where you have a lot of space for cars to stop from both roads with direction Sofia. Since I live in VT, I used it a lot, and never had to wait very long. You can stand with both thumbs up in the same time.
waited only for 9 minutes with a sign for Burgas. there is quite a lot of traffic and the cars drive slow because there is a traffic light
A very good petrol station directly before the highway leaves Varna southwards. A Busstop is just next to it e.g. Tollibus 88.
Stood with a sign "Bucharest" and was almost immediately picked up and taken to Ruse
There is an OMW petrol station. Ask the people who would take you to Veliki Tarnovo.
Go to the end of the highway entrance and there you will find perfect place in Turkey's direction
bus #211 took me here.

after the junction.
direction: Sozopol.
Good spot, but in the peak of traffic, police take that place to control the traffic. In that situation better to go to Pobeda roundabout
Lot of traffic and plenty of space to stop
Not a huge traffic (Sunday morning) but the road leave Svilengrad toward Sofia.
Probably one of the best spots to get out of Svilengrad. Not a lot of traffic but people stop very quickly and go a long way - direct lifts to Sofia are not uncommon
Plenty of space, slow traffic, big pullover area. Got a ride with English speaking couple in 20 mins.
Just before the petrol station. It's a good spot to get a ride to the main road west of Bansko, and also to Sofia(I got it in 10 minutes).
Good spot to get towards Razgrad

Prendre le bus numéro 1 puis marcher 45 minutes jusqu’à la bretelle d’autoroute. Sans panneau, deux voitures se sont arrêtées en 15 minutes mais les deux allaient vers l’Ouest. Après 40 minutes d’attente au totale, un homme s’arrête et nous (ma femme et moi) dépose à la frontière Turque (notre destination). Bon spot pour sortir de Plovdiv

Good spot. Everyone goes towards Macedonia. Had a sign "Macedonia". A truck with macedonian driver stoped and luckily I got a ride almost to Skopje (driver went to Tetovo and had to drop me before Skopje, so the rest I just walked)

On my way to Macedonia. Good stop has enough space for cars to stop. Has a sign "Macedonia" in both cyrillic and latin. A couple took me to a bordering city where it's easier to get a ride to Macedonia.
Towards Macedonia, got a ride to Logodazh
Had a sign for MKD, not a lot of Macedonian cars but I got a ride to close to the border next to Blagoevgrad
Despite it being dark and me standing with a sign I got picked up all the way to Sofia quickly. The lights are good enough for nighttime hitchhiking, otherwise there’s always the gas station.
Super good spot for south. Got a ride to blagoevgrad in 10 seconds

No one wanted to give me a ride at the truck stop, so I got frustrated and was going to walk across the border to Romania. But as I was walking past a gas station, I saw a car and asked if he can take me across the border. It turned out that he was going to Bucharest.
An excellent location under the highway to catch a ride from Plovdiv to Sofia. This is where the ramp to the highway begins, and vehicles have sufficient time and space to stop.
Got lucky and found people willing to take me further than my sign but good space for people to stop single lane traffic moving at a medium speed.
Second car got me
I waited a bit but it was like the 10th car that stopped. Very very quick
Super easy to get a short ride, because it’s a small town. We are trying to go to Kjustandil as a border city to get to Skopje, because Kjustandil got us recommended by a local to cross the border
Good spot. Easy to be seen, slow speed due to road bump and easy for cars to park at the gas station.
Fair amount of traffic. Most cars are going out of the city. There is good space in the pull-out area, making it safe to stand with a sign next to the road.
Got a ride instantly. Tons of cars driving by. Low speed due to the roundabout and a good spot for stopping.
Excellent spot. A lot of traffic in the southern direction. Couple of gas stations in a row. High visibility for cars and super easy to stop.
Good spot, no/few busses and slow traffic due to uphill traffic light.
Pretty quick tbh
Literally put the thumb up and the first car stopped
We were taken by a family with two kids. They drove us very fast to Burgas and they said that they could take us to chernomorets and they did very very cool.
15 max. Very quick. Went to Plovdiv.
Good spot for Karlovo or even Sofia, enough space
Stood with a sign Veliko Tarnovo and got picked up in less than 5 minutes
Super spot, we were two people with our backpacks and we waited for a very short time!
Got dropped here in the early morning and very quickly got taken by a truck driver to Plovdiv. Seems to be a good spot.
My ride from the day before had invited me to stay the night and took me to the other side of Sofia to a great spot towards Plovdiv early in the morning.
My previous ride asked a guy that was filling his car at the petrol station and he took me to Sofia. He said it's easier to go to Sofia through the Highway west of Dupniza than through Pernik.

A lot of space, not a lot of traffic, but seems easy. Got taken by a guy that used to hitchhike in the socialist times of Bulgaria. He got me to Kjustendil to a petrol station and immediately found me a ride to Sofia.
Ride straight to Varna, no long time waiting, plenty room for car to stop.
Ride to Constanța, the guy left us in Drobvich on a good spot to continue our trip
Hitchhiked for Dobrich and we ended up just to the next town where we got a second ride after 5min
Tried the spot at the gas station, no one came, seemed wrong to walk onto the highway but it worked perfectly! A gut directly stopped :)
Great spot for the border!
Great spot for Plovdid/Burgas. Found a ride in no time.
Very sunny, but the spot is not bad, cars go slowly tho usually most of them cannot stop due to traffic, two cars offered me a ride
Cars go slowly, enough time and space to stop, two cars offered a ride.
there is often a long cue of trucks waiting for the toll (since bulgaria is not a schengen country) and you can walk along the cue with your sign and find a pretty long ride

if you’re going towards montana/vidin, this seems to be by far the best spot for hitchhiking in the area (got dropped off there by an experienced fellow hitchhiker) and eventually got a my first longer lift of the day. there’s also a restaurant and a shelter and forest surrounding and you could comfortably spend the night there. 
03/12/2023
Tramprennen 2023 - Just a spot in the middle of the road, but here there's shade, river and a water fountain next to it. Sweet spot, though cars will go fast, they can stop safely

who: 2 white women
when: sunny sunday 9 am
wait time: 2 mins
where to: kardzali
Good spot. Tankstation is big and you have different restaurants and shops. We got a ride in 5 minutes to Plovdiv.
Some local guys took us there to catch something to Borovets. Very good spot
You can ask drivers there or stand with the sign before the entrance to the gas station
But the petrol station has also great spot behind to sleep under the tent under the tree ;)
We were standing here with BUCURESTI board so maybe it wasn't the best idea, but after 1 hour a car stopped and took us to Velke Tarnovo.
you have to take Bus number 90 to get there (after you took tram 22 to its last station) Seemed like a good spot, but we waited for hours without anybody even stopping... maybe bad luck...
this is the highway to Northern Bulgaria, not Plovdiv
November 2012. We were waiting with my wife for 45 min. But at the end VW Tuareg drove us straight to Bucharest
Double lane traffic moving relatively fast but it’s at a gas station so good to just get moving along.
Petrol Station. Great Spot for hh to varna!
Main road to Burgas and Varna (opposite direction). Heavy traffic.
Good spot towards Schumen, especially in the morning there is a lot of traffic there. Just stood here with a sign and my thumb out.
Great spot to go to Shumen or sophia. Tradic is slow and there is a lot of space to stop . But people not looking on sigh alot but its great spot.
the road to Veliko Tarnovo and Sofia. quite good and popular place with lots of traffic.
This spot is terrible now. Unhichable. Try going a bit further down, after the roundabout.

When going to Turkey, don't bother using a sign here. There won't be any direct traffic because that will take the (practically unhitchable) highway, so just put out your thumb, get a ride to the next (sizable) town (Haskovo in this case) and repeat from there until you get to the border.
is it a safe route ? i will arrive late at night and i need to reach istanbul, would it be possible to arrive in the morning ?
not soo many trucks going to turkey but you can find a lift to get out of plovdiv. we were lucky and get a lift to the border

We were very lucky to the border, but after the border traffic was very slow. Most people seem to be going to Edirne from the border. Also, beware of people asking for (a lot of) money, thinking you actually need a taxi.
Just wanted to get to the highway. Took a little long but once I wrote a sign saying 5 km I got picked up right away. I would recommend a sign
I waited close to the bus station and a local woman quickly took me a bit up the road to the highway entrance.

I mean it’s fine, it’s a border so it’s always good. I was there after dark and it took me a long time to get a ride. A bus stopped and I paid for it to take me to Sofia because I don’t have camping gear and was freezing my ass off. If you get there in the day it should be fine
The border is a great place to get a ride into Bulgaria! Many trucks, easy to go to Sofia. I didn't even need to ask, just started talking with the truck drivers, and one offered me a ride!
An excellent spot to go to Bucharest or Ruse.
it took quite a while to walk here from the town but it was worth the walk... a car stopped almost instantly and took us two to Ruse where we were headed
The spot is in the insertion place for highway but car can stop on a side and it a very good sport to the way to Istanbul !

I waited at the on ramp and was about to try going onto the highway directly when someone stopped and took me to the split in the highway towards Burgas/Edirne. I wanted to go to Edirne, he would have gone to Burgas.
good spot but driver was abit touchy
Not many cars drive here but the 5th car stopped and a couple of locals drove us all the way to Rila Monastery (even though it was not on their way)

Ĉi tiu loko estas absolute mirinda. Mi alvenis ĉi tien ĉirkaŭ la oka vespere. Jam estis mallume. Tie estas lampfosto, kiu ne funkcias. Eĉ sen ia lumo, aŭtoj pasas tiel malrapide, ke ili havas sufiĉe da tempo por vidi vin. Mi metis min super la finon de la triangulo, meze de la vojo, fronte al tiu, kiun mi volis, kaj metis malgrandan lanternon por igi min iom pli videbla, krom uzi la reflektajn ŝtofojn, kiujn mi ricevis en "tramprennen" por mi kaj Daniela Loti.

Tri ciganaj fratoj prenis min du
Good cross to catch a car to sofia direction
Direction Sofia
You will be standing at a very inconvenient place for traffic. Cars stop just to get you away from the road. Honking etc. A bit crazy, but fast.
to Provadija. you can expect for short rides.
Cars are driving fast on the road. The petrol station is busy, people are helpful, mostly going to the north or east, but not west
Perfect place. Direction Stara Zagora, Burgas, Varna, Romania. There is a gas station. All buses to Dimitrovgrad can leave you here, just ask the driver.
good spot, plenty of space to stop. got a ride in like 10/15 mins to burgas. theres a gas station at the other side of the road where you can use the toilet

there's lot of space to stop next to the road.
direction: Burgas.
got a ride to the serbian border with a bit of waiting. No ride directly to belgrad...
2h30 wait to get to Slivnitsa as a solo male backpacker. The spot is good, people have a good spot to stop and trafic is abundant.
great place to hh to Serbia, much place for cars to stop, waited 15min (solo male backpacker, sign "Beograd")
Very good spot for hitchhiking, lot of space and car must slow down due to speed bump. I had the sign and I waited just 2-3 minutes and then car from Novi Sad, Serbia stopped
I stood few meters after this spot, and got a short ride to a better spot. But I was without a sign...
Fantastic spot but a nightmare to get to by foot
You can also catch a bus from VT to get here easily, it costs 70 stotinki I believe. Hitching with no sign got me picked up to Stara Zagora in 30 minutes.

I made a sign that said İstanbul/Свиленград and it took me about 40 minutes to find someone (I was trying to find a truck driver). If you want you can try and hitchhike a couple kilometers south to one of the truck stops (check Google Maps as I don't know the exact locations) where you will probably find a helpful trucker. Just after the gas station there is a spot for cars to pull over.

If you are walking here, try to not get (your shoes) too dirty from the mud and sand next to the road, as th
gateway to South Bulgaria. There is a gas staion here and enough room for cars to pull over. You have to walk to here from the town(25-30min).

Can be reached by 15min after last stop of bus 54 which starts from Metro Slivnitsa. 
Got picked up by two Serbian girls on their way back home.
Didn't wait long for a ride to Dragoman, might be better to wait for a ride to at least the border.
There's a parking in front of the motel (big enough for truck to stop). You can get a lift straight to the Serbian border or even to Belgrade.
Guards are human-friendly and let you stay between the two post offices. Got a shot instantly.
take the road towards the mountains! its a bit more difficult to hitch along the way, but its def. more adventurous, and the sights are INCREDIBLE!
Lots of traffic also going south direction greece, thessaloniki or athens. U can also sleep near the greek custom, there is a closed tourist office next to the bar with a perfect outside roof
the border is okay. not very busy, but many bulgarians crossing and they are picking up.
Good place to search car to Serbia
more than one hour waiting... but still the best place to hh to serbian border

Also think that this is probably the best place for hitchhiking towards Serbia (although it was still a bit tricky - waiting time for me: 1.5h for a direct ride to Nis). Just after the traffic light and the entrance to the gas station there's enough space for cars to pull over.
Nest place to hh towards Serbia, both gas station and traffic light, just hold 3 fingers and wait for numerous serbian truckers

Traffic light
30 sec red full stop
30 sec green light. 
best way to get to the border next to gas station and shopping mall METRO, to get here take subway to slivnica station and bus 54 to the METRO shopping mall
Got a ride to the last petrol station before the split Burgas-Turkey.
We waited one hour, direction Sofia, but it was dark: anyway I think it's a good spot.
not that bad for sofia too.

althoug it's a motorway, you can try here. i also did it and worked: we were five splitted two groups and got lift within an hour.
direction: Burgas, Istambul.
Pretty decent spot
Good place to hitchhike towards Sofia and other tows to the West of Plovdiv. A lot of drivers prefer this exit when going to Sofia
I think this mark is meant to be one round about firther down the road, because thats where all the traffic from Schumen towards Ruse leaves. Here its mostly local cars.

To Razgrad, Ruse. There is some small traffic police house which is usually empty. A lot of space, a lot of cars. Perfect! Unfortunately, it's difficult to reach from Shumen. Hhiked here every time I got a ride from Varna to Shumen and wanted to go on to Ruse or Romania.
Good spot on the way to Sofia
If you take some bus out of Pleven, you can ask to be dropped off here and hitch here towards Sofia, where traffic from both roads merges.
The border police stopped Macedonian cars and helped me get one to the border

Not a lot of traffic south but I am giving 4 stars cause it was shady and had a spot to sit. I got lucky after 25 mins and a taxi already going to the border took me without having to pay. 1 male with a sign that said Kulata

We tried to hitchhike to Istanbul. Overall, the location seemed quite good, but we had significant difficulties – few drivers were heading to Istanbul; most were heading towards Burgas, and the Turks heading to Istanbul were reluctant to pick up additional passengers. Eventually, we managed to hitchhike to a gas station outside Plovdiv.

I stood there with a sign saying "Ruse." The problem was that it was already late for such a long journey (8 p.m.). However, one guy offered to take me to Pleven. There is a lot of traffic at the gas station and at the exit.
No shade but pretty good spot because it’s mostly long distance drivers either truckers or Germans coming back (those usually have full cars though)
first guy who came along offered me a lift, young man but a good driver going to blagoevgrad to play football
A lot of cars. Got asked by someone who had parked if I wanted a lift.
No shade, but a place for cars to stop, this town should be avoided though and I got lucky. Spot itself is good for this town, but its not the greatest ever

Had a sign to "Elhovo". Had to wait a bit, since not a lot of cars are passing by. Good long dirt pull-out section. Easy to be spotted from the roundabout.

Couple of border police cars, but all no one stopped this time.

Got picked up and got a trip all the way to Svilengrad.

Hitchhiked without a sign. Had memorized the city names of "Generalovo" and "Kapitan Andreevo".

Driver asked me where I was going to. Said the two names and he asked to get in. I said I was going to Turkey and he drove me to the parking spot next to the border. 

Not a lot of cars, but slow traffic and a big area for parking.

Got picked up here, when walking out of the city with a sign. Had not decided when to start hitchhiking yet.

Gives it a 4-star, since I don't know if this is a good spot for other people.
Very slow traffic due to speed bump plus roads merging.
There was a pothole so a lot of noise. And was difficult to get there. Otherwise alr. There was shade.

Good spot towards Sofia. Take bus 2, 5 or 110 to get around here. You can wait at the bus stop of 110 (bus runs less often, so won’t block buses). Busy traffic. Waited 15 min. I'm a solo woman traveller.
Small parking spot on the main road (in both directions), not that much traffic

Got dropped of at the split of the highway and then walked onto the highway towards Edirne. First a local woman stopped, but she'd only go into the next town and not long after a Turkish truck driver took me to a truck park close to the border.
Hard to get there, had to walk by the side of the road, then only waited 20min at the Spot, guy Took me to haskovo (had that on the sign), from here I will HH to svilengrad and then Istanbul :)
enough space to pull over just before the bridge and after police control (so cars need to slow down)
Quite a good spot just before the gas station, catch local and transit traffic direction Stara Zagora or Burgas, easy to get direct ride to Stara Zagora
Most cars go to the next villages Kran and Shipka. You can get off at Shipka and continue towards Gabrovo or wait for a ride crossing he mountains to the north
Not ideal but works eventually! To Harkovo.
A convenient and long bus stop for the cars to stop.

Directly on the highway, but with a big shoulder for cars to stop. Border police stopped to see what we were doing but were friendly and didn't care we were walking on the highway. Not a lot of traffic, but not too bad.
If there are any cars coming, they will likely take you through
I was walking down the intersection and a car stopped before I thumbed on the main highway
Got spot how to set to the borders between Bulgaria And Turkey. Also good way to get to Istanbul.

reading the previous comments you can understand that it is very difficult to find transportation here. I was lucky and after an hour a kind gentleman from Turkey picked me up directly to Sofia. If it wasn't him I would probably have been standing in this place for hours.
the most frustrating thing about this spot is that it's mostly expatriate Turks going to Western Europe, so their are super full
I was a bit scared no one would stop here, but the third or fourth car took me to Haskovo.
No-one would stop on the highway, traffic was moving fast [Blog Post](http://www.hobospirit.com/hitchhiking-from-edirne-turkey-to-veliko-tarnovo-bulgaria)

Direction West. Just walk along the new highway until where the truck and car lanes come together again. Just hitch on the highway (not really busy, so no problems for cars to stop). There is enough car and truck traffic on this border - so hitching should be no problem.
Some locals took us to the nearest town  rarely quickly but there is no shade and being the border there aren’t really any cheap food options

just walk a few meters after the border there is a petrolstation (for some needs) stay on the street and try to stop cars there are not that fast so its quite easy, a sign would be good there. ask the drivers for Eihovo thats the next bigger twon after the border.
good for greece, easy to get by buss and lot of space for others
Gas station somewhere there where you can ask
That's the old spot before the highway was build, don't use this spot now, go to the beginning of the highway
Waited for 10 min until got picked by for 30 km until better spot. Cars going pretty fast, so might take time.
the last bus stop before it goes off the main road. calmed down traffic and good visibility!

not bad, mountain passage can be closed during winter times. Easy to get to the peak or Gabrovo, but if u try to get from Kazanlak to Veliko Tarnovo better hitch at Kazanlak east and try going via Gurkovo
not a bad spot, although at some period of the year you can find low traffic.
Stood with a sign "Bucharest"

Direction: city centre
..always better than taking the taxi. There wasn't very much traffic, though.

Very good spot with high visibility and a shoulder for cars to stop. Got picked up to go to Dragoman. The trafic is not huge, but a good amount of international plates so if you are heading towards Serbia it's a good spot
they go pretty fast, so i don't recommend it
It's uphill, so cars see you from a greater distance.
A bus stop. I got a ride to Bansko after 30 minutes on Sunday morning...

From E79 you need to walk to here (150m).
There is a bus station and is good place to hitch towards Bansko or Gotse Delchev.
I took this recommendation seriously, walked across the border and second guy I have asked took me. You have to ask though or it doesnt work
I found a ride towards Varna asking people that stopped at the shop after the border
Not a very good place. We wait 1 day long in Durankulak and noone stopped.

Not a very popular road, on the Bulgarian side there are just some villages so this is not the main road one would take to get to Bulgaria so no trucks.
Closest trucks go is Negru Voda.
the same me... easier to take a bus! but later I came back there in the winter, when there were no buses... was quite ok with hitchin' :)
Dangerous, but fast and a good option towards south
It's dangerous and not easy to get to this place, but we didn't wait long to get someone going to the south. Cars are realy fast there.

Very dangerous place...
There is a very big traffic, even when there is almost no cars in the south direction, generally for most of the drivers their goal is Sofia.

Finally and luckily we have catch something, but I really, really do not recommend this place!
Good traffic, but some waiting. Had a sign Sofia and some Turkish guys coming from Antwerp going to Fethiye gave me a lift to Sofia.
As told above, it is a quite messy spot, but it is also the only possible. We got a ride all the way to the Turkish border fast.

Walking from the border (going into Bulgaria) I held up my sign reading "Sofia" every time a car passed by (2 or 3 every 5 minutes or so on a Thursday afternoon in November), and was picked up within 5 minutes.
if you're going towards Sofia, I think it's better to hitchhike few meters after Shell petrol station than at the spot where this marker is

(Late August 2012) I had a car up to Pirot, but when I saw all the cars waiting here, I just got in the middle of the queue to ask people if they were able to pick me. I found a car directly for the French Alps. With the registration plate, it was easy to choose.
